questions.question_text: Which are valid modes for a switch port used as a VLAN trunk? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: Correct answer is B, C, D

choices.A: decreasing the number of collision domains
choices.E: increasing the maximum length of UTP cabling between devices BC
choices.B: filtering frames based on MAC addresses
choices.D: increasing the size of broadcast domains

questions.question_text: What are two advantages of Layer 2 Ethernet switches over hubs? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: For VLAN trunking (Inter-vlan routing), sub-interfaces must be created, there must be an IP address. Answer: B,D,E

questions.question_text: Which three elements must be used when you configure a router interface for VLAN trunking? (Choose three.)

choices.F: subinterface numbering that matches VLAN tags. BDE
choices.D: subinterface encapsulation identifiers that match VLAN tags.
choices.A: one physical interface for each subinterface.
choices.C: a management domain for each subinterface.
choices.B: one IP network or subnetwork for each subinterface.

choices.D: The connection between switches should be a trunk.
choices.A: This design will function as intended.
choices.C: The router will not accept the addressing scheme.
choices.E: The router interfaces must be encapsulated with the 802.1Q protocol.
choices.B: Spanning-tree will need to be used.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
A network technician is asked to design a small network with redundancy.
The exhibit represents this design, with all hosts configured in the same VLAN.
What conclusions can be made about this design?
//IMG//

discussion.content: The proposed addressing scheme is on the same network. Cisco routers will not allow you to assign two different interfaces to be on the same IP subnet.

questions.question_text: How many bits are contained in each field of an IPv6 address?
